Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*

Masvingo has 24 Schools that collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools such as *Pamushana, St. Antony’s, Reformed Church Gutu, Dewure High, Chiredzi High* and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita- Madam Makomeke. We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central and East) Province, *Midlands Province(Fletcher, Regina Mundi, etc). Mathebeland(North, South) we have St Mark’s, Usher High, Plumtree, Sizane High etc.* Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo add a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in 14 years. 78 - 09 Jan 2024 02:11PM - Arshita: Let me share with you the cost of higher education in India compared to other global hubs.  In India, international students face an average expense of *$6000-$8000 annually.* While this is very low as compared to the Western education hubs such as the US, UK, Canada, Germany, etc where the cost of education ranges from $15000-$35000 annually, it is still beyond the reach of many.  With the Edoofa Scholarship Program, the cost trips down to *$2000-$3000 per annum* for the students who are found eligible for the program by qualifying the Eligibility Check Process. This reduced cost includes: *1. Remaining Tuition fees (if any)* *2. Basic University Expenses (Library, Wifi, Laundry, etc.)* *3. Food* *4. Accommodation*

107 - 06 Jan 2024 12:04PM - Gurvinder: Mungala, The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on student’s performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing – just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics.  Promising a better future for its students, and converting an Individual into a Market Ready Professional. 280 - 09 Jan 2024 03:58PM - +263 71 256 8023: Section 5  Is it true that many Africans have poor diets because their farms are stagnant and inefficient?   From my point of view l disagree that many Africans have poor diets because their farms are stagnant and inefficient. Climatic events which destroy crops and disrupt food are disproportionately common in the region. Many parts of Africa experience irregular rainfall and extreme weather conditions which can lead to drought, floods and many more.  Flooding depletes soils of oxygen and increases disease infections and nitrogen losses. Flooding can significantly alter the level of plant available nutrients in the soil. Flooding causes soil erosion which takes valuable plant available nutrients and organic matter.  Drought  is another natural disaster which causes destruction of plants. Drought weakens plants and predisposes them to secondary invaders and opportunitic pests. These include diseases such as vascular wilts and root rots. The roots strive to uptake more water through their expansion and this ultimately adapts plants to minimize stomatal loss of water deficit. Plants are usually slow growing and stunted.  In Africa there is also high rates of veld fires which causes destruction of plants thereby causing shortage of food and wildlife. The climatic conditions in Africa are not reliable anymore because weather patterns can change any time. Farmers in African are also facing challenges such as lack ok technology, lack of machinery, lack of irrigations and lack of capital. Some farmers may even have challenge in attaining inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and pesticides. This thereby causes lack of enough food for everyone in the nation.   Africans  also face challenges such as transportation of their good because poor   transport systems such as roads and railway lines. Another reason why Africans have shortage of food is that, many African countries export their crops to other countries instead of keeping them for example storing grain in silos for future use for example during drought. This causes shortage of food because all of it has been exported. Many Africans have lack of education which causes them to not be aware of what a balanced diet is. Poverty also causes Africans to have poor diets. Poverty limits people's ability to purchase healthy food so as to have balanced diet. Poverty causes people to rely on affordable foods which might not be healthy or be able to complete the balanced diet.  Supply chain costs and related issues are a major obstacle to the renaissance of African agriculture. Making food supply chains more sufficient and profitable requires reliable and efficient delivery of the upstream goods and services, as well as downstream delivery of goods to the market.  Overpopulation in Africa may cause reduction in food adequacy, leading to inadequate food intake or intake of foods of poor nutritional quality and quantity.  However l believe that these challenges of having poor diets in Africa can be solved by teaching Africans about the importance of a banced diet.

64 - 09 Jan 2024 03:02PM - Kunal: *B.Tech. Mechanical Engineering* is a 4-year undergraduate course  First thing any engineering aspirant considers while choosing a branch in Engineering is placement aspect and the course very well caters to it. A few questions which arise when admissions to engineering colleges commence include the branch in demand, highest paid engineering graduates and others such.  Apart from this palcement criteria, there are some other parameters which should be considered while choosing a discipline like- what are the research opportunities, what is scope of career growth etc.  Mechanical Engineering is the evergreen branch of engineering. Market scenario and demand of engineering graduates change every year but the demand of mechanical engineering degree will never be obsolete. Mechanical engineering graduates can find placements in almost every sector, right from construction sector to steel industry and from automobile to software.  Following are the sub disciplines that are associated with mechanical engineering:  *Production Engineering* *Industrial Engineering* *Manufacturing Engineering* *Automobile Engineering* *Artificial Intelligence*  The field of mechanical engineering can be thought of as a collection of many mechanical engineering science disciplines. Several of these subdisciplines which are typically taught at the undergraduate level are listed below, with a brief explanation and the most common application of each. Some of these subdisciplines are unique to mechanical engineering, while others are a combination of mechanical engineering and one or more other disciplines. Most work that a mechanical engineer does uses skills and techniques from several of these subdisciplines, as well as specialized subdisciplines. Specialized subdisciplines, as used in this article, are more likely to be the subject of graduate studies or on-the-job training than undergraduate research. Several specialized sub disciplines are discussed in this section.  *Mechanics*  Mechanics is, in the most general sense, the study of forces and their effect upon matter. Typically, engineering mechanics is used to analyze and predict the acceleration and deformation (both elastic and plastic) of objects under known forces (also called loads) or stresses. Subdisciplines of mechanics include Statics, the study of non-moving bodies under known loads, how forces affect static bodies Dynamics the study of how forces affect moving bodies. Dynamics includes kinematics (about movement, velocity, and acceleration) and kinetics (about forces and resulting accelerations). Mechanics of materials, the study of how different materials deform under various types of stress Fluid mechanics, the study of how fluids react to forces Kinematics, the study of the motion of bodies (objects) and systems (groups of objects), while ignoring the forces that cause the motion. Kinematics is often used in the design and analysis of mechanisms. Continuum mechanics, a method of applying mechanics that assumes that objects are continuous (rather than discrete) Mechanical engineers typically use mechanics in the design or analysis phases of engineering. If the engineering project were the design of a vehicle, statics might be employed to design the frame of the vehicle, in order to evaluate where the stresses will be most intense. Dynamics might be used when designing the car's engine, to evaluate the forces in the pistons and cams as the engine cycles. Mechanics of materials might be used to choose appropriate materials for the frame and engine. Fluid mechanics might be used to design a ventilation system for the vehicle (see HVAC), or to design the intake system for the engine  *Mechatronics and Robotics*  Mechatronics is a combination of mechanics and electronics. It is an interdisciplinary branch of mechanical engineering, electrical engineering and software engineering that is concerned with integrating electrical and mechanical engineering to create hybrid systems. In this way, machines can be automated through the use of electric motors, servo-mechanisms, and other electrical systems in conjunction with special software. A common example of a mechatronics system is a CD-ROM drive. Mechanical systems open and close the drive, spin the CD and move the laser, while an optical system reads the data on the CD and converts it to bits. Integrated software controls the process and communicates the contents of the CD to the computer.  Robotics is the application of mechatronics to create robots, which are often used in industry to perform tasks that are dangerous, unpleasant, or repetitive. These robots may be of any shape and size, but all are preprogrammed and interact physically with the world. To create a robot, an engineer typically employs kinematics (to determine the robot's range of motion) and mechanics (to determine the stresses within the robot).  Robots are used extensively in industrial engineering. They allow businesses to save money on labor, perform tasks that are either too dangerous or too precise for humans to perform them economically, and to ensure better quality. Many companies employ assembly lines of robots, especially in Automotive Industries and some factories are so robotized that they can run by themselves. Outside the factory, robots have been employed in bomb disposal, space exploration, and many other fields. Robots are also sold for various residential applications, from recreation to domestic applications.  *Thermodynamics and Thermo-science*  Thermodynamics is an applied science used in several branches of engineering, including mechanical and chemical engineering. At its simplest, thermodynamics is the study of energy, its use and transformation through a system. Typically, engineering thermodynamics is concerned with changing energy from one form to another. As an example, automotive engines convert chemical energy (enthalpy) from the fuel into heat, and then into mechanical work that eventually turns the wheels.  Thermodynamics principles are used by mechanical engineers in the fields of heat transfer, thermofluids, and energy conversion. Mechanical engineers use thermo-science to design engines and power plants, heating, ventilation, and air-conditioning (HVAC) systems, heat exchangers, heat sinks, radiators, refrigeration, insulation, and others.  *Design and drafting*  Drafting or technical drawing is the means by which mechanical engineers design products and create instructions for manufacturing parts. A technical drawing can be a computer model or hand-drawn schematic showing all the dimensions necessary to manufacture a part, as well as assembly notes, a list of required materials, and other pertinent information. A U.S. mechanical engineer or skilled worker who creates technical drawings may be referred to as a drafter or draftsman. Drafting has historically been a two-dimensional process, but computer-aided design (CAD) programs now allow the designer to create in three dimensions.  Instructions for manufacturing a part must be fed to the necessary machinery, either manually, through programmed instructions, or through the use of a computer-aided manufacturing (CAM) or combined CAD/CAM program. Optionally, an engineer may also manually manufacture a part using the technical drawings. However, with the advent of computer numerically controlled (CNC) manufacturing, parts can now be fabricated without the need for constant technician input. Manually manufactured parts generally consist of spray coatings, surface finishes, and other processes that cannot economically or practically be done by a machine.  Drafting is used in nearly every subdiscipline of mechanical engineering, and by many other branches of engineering and architecture. Three-dimensional models created using CAD software are also commonly used in finite element analysis (FEA) and computational fluid dynamics (CFD).

92 - 09 Jan 2024 12:15PM - Pallika Edoofa: *BBA IT stands for Bachelors of Business Administration Information Technology*, it is an undergraduate course degree pursued by many individuals to work efficiently in the sector of business administration with special skills and emphasis on information technology. This course offers a combined study of the principles of management as well as Information Technology. It prepares a student for a career in the technology departments of MNCs and many other major corporations where there is extensive use of technology to support hired personnel. Majority of the business owners today have become heavily dependent on technological resources and various markets have been transformed and transitioned into full-fledged online mode. Hence the need to administer efficient business via information technology have become a useful source of study discipline and has been incorporated in many business administration curriculums as an acknowledged sub branch of today's business scenario. BBA IT course curriculum is designed around the key technology-related requirements of businesses. It covers computer science, information database management, and networking Information technology and also includes information management theory and related technology applications. After pursuing this course graduates can also opt for MBA Courses as it will help them earn a handsome amount of money as MBA Jobs are high in demand.  *BBA IT: What is About?* BBA IT, as the name suggests is an undergraduate program in Business Administration and Information Technology. Over the years, due to the spiralling growth in the Technology industry, the program has seen increasing popularity. Enumerated below, find the details of this course.  BBA in Information Technology allows its aspirants to venture in the field of computer application where businesses have potential to complete their sales online without any hindrances or delay.  This consists of techniques and methodologies that are essential in functioning of a business online such as maintenance of data, ensuring online bank services for payment and sale and purchase of goods and commodities without compromising their quality and authenticity.  BBA in Information Technology graduates have a wide variety of choices available as there are many potential well established firms and organizations ready to employ personnel skilled with necessary knowledge of current information technology trends.  Throughout the course, students develop a good hold on how to apply technology-based solutions to the problems faced by businesses.  This course focuses on the managerial skills of the candidate along with the managerial skills.  *Why Choose BBA IT?* The BBA in Information Technology program is seeing rising popularity with today’s generation of students. Some of the reasons, why this program is getting increasingly popular and why anyone should study this program are given below  BBA in information technology can produce new Professional designations which offer exciting monetary bonuses and rewards, these new professional offer exposure and experience and provide larger base of expansion and knowledge  Assimilation of business management skills with dynamic information technology can produce efficient sales and profit making capability.  BBA in information technology graduates can work in a number of professions such as network security experts and web designer and information systems officer which can earn them a livelihood with good money deals.  Graduates of this discipline are often employed with commercial giants such as Amazon, Accenture, Flipkart and Snapdeal which allow their employees regular incentives and benefits with good working timings and vacations.  BBA in information technology has immense scope since businesses all over the world have been using online platforms to promote their organizations and products, hence job vacancies in this discipline will always be available and profitable.  As many businesses and organizations are catering to the needs of the world and distribution of goods has become global, the need to accommodate new technology as a dependable source has led to the rise of the information technology sector; hence it is immensely important to know the structure and functioning of information technology in today's world.  *What is the BBA IT Career and Job Prospects?* BBA in information technology offers majority key roles and designations in many industries and sectors of business and economy related arenas, every business in its entirety is essential and requires information technology skills to promote its wellbeing, success and longevity, hence this course program can provide opportunities in areas such as:  Individuals eager to learn the basics of information technology can surely thrive in their business careers by either embarking on independent endeavor or working in multinational companies, e-commerce and information security management companies on leadership roles and position which also are packed with many rewards and benefits  Candidates with a BBA in IT can always pursue higher learning such as an MBA program in this field and contribute their efforts and skills in the education sector by becoming teachers and professors.  Candidates can also work in major information technology infrastructure companies that facilitate and manage databases as well as tools and equipment to organizations and help them set up their IT business.  Candidates can also contribute as network managers who are responsible for taking care of network issues to ensure regular flow of the network to avoid various business blockages. Hence such individuals keep the network intact by regularly providing server maintenance work and performing antivirus checks.  *What is the Future Scope of BBA IT?* BBA in information technology is a blossoming industry and requires dedication and commitment to work long term and earn recognition. Information Technology has become revolutionary with its global reach and digitally packed transactions to secure better client base with stable growth and profitability, hence BBA in Information Technology degree has immense scope and its future is promising and solid  BBA in IT graduates can always pursue higher education such as MBA courses to work in the teaching industry as many universities and colleges in India require skilled teachers to teach students about this sector and make them aware of its possible career potentials.  They can also venture in multinational companies and work as a corporate secretary specialization in information technology and provide services to other departments of the organization about usage of IT infrastructure and its benefits.  Such graduates can also work as website developers and help local or regional business owners in establishing an online market by designing a website to facilitate their business activities online. Website developing is a highly creative job and offers exciting monetary rewards.  BBA in information technology graduates can open their individual businesses related to IT infrastructure. Such individuals can involve themselves with the sale and purchase of various IT instruments and can facilitate other organizations by setting up their information technology framework.

It is through the *Earn While You Learn Program*  The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn scholarship credits (based on student’s performance) that are equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.The Earn While You Learn Program helps the students to learn and develop the skills necessary for the digital workspace environment- which namely include Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing – just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies and needs, converting an Individual into a market-ready professional. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on student’s performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing – just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics. 139 - 09 Jan 2024 10:49AM - Shubham Madhwal: The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on student’s performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing – just to name a few.

The first part will be paid in August (2024- 2025) and the remaining in January next year (2025-2026).  3. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. 26 - 09 Jan 2024 01:08PM - +263 77 717 1803: As parents we are excited to have our son linked with Edoofa and pray that he will succeed in getting the scholarship.  I am his father with a Bachelor's Degree in Business Studies.  I used to manage well established companies, but unfortunately our economy took a downturn that led to the closure of many companies.  During our time at University the thrust was on strategic management and companies that needed muanagers of that calibre were many.  Now, with the Land reform process the economic structure changed.  Commercial farms that were the backbone of the agricultural sector were disabled.  Commercial Farmers left and the farms were subdivided into smaller portions and distributed to the locals.  This had an adverse effect on the industry performance.  The economy became informal.  I lost my job and got into the informally sector, in my case farming projects such as piggery, poultry etc.  I had hoped that we could access bank loans but this did not work out. The banking sector is struggling; we are a major risk to them.  Yes we are trudging in but unfortunately will not be able to make our son realise his dreams.  And this is where our joy came when we got to know about Edoofa.  We are confident of our son's performance; but we are handicapped financially.  My wife is a tailor but again this will not enable us to take our son to University.  What really motivates me to support our son to study abroad is the quality, focus and exposure that comes with studying abroad.  The world is now a global village and interaction at that level is extremely good for our son.  He will also increase his chances of employment outside Zimbabwe and ultimately help his family back home and his country as well.
